item.title: Kameny memorial unveiled at LGBT Veterans Day ceremony
item.description:
Kameny memorial unveiled at LGBT Veterans Day ceremony

Four gay members of the Army and one from the Navy stood at attention in full dress uniform Wednesday morning as U.S. Air Force General Counsel Gordon O. Tanner and Congressional Cemetery President Paul Williams unveiled a newly installed memorial headstone for gay rights pioneer Frank Kameny.

item.title: DC Different Drummers | Flash Mob | Gay News | Washington Blade
item.description:
DC Different Drummers | Flash Mob | Gay News | Washington Blade

The D.C. Different Drummers, an LGBT-inclusive marching and symphonic band, performed in a surprise flash mob at Dupont Circle on Monday, much to the delight of unsuspecting bystanders. The band performed an unexpected set of top-40 hits like Lady Gaga's "Pokerface" and "Bad Romance" as well as Ke$ha's "Your Love is My Drug."

item.title: Independence Day in D.C.
item.description:
Independence Day in D.C.

Snapshots of modern America

item.title: Lesbian & Gay Band Assoc. part of Inauguration | Gay News
item.description:
Lesbian & Gay Band Assoc. part of Inauguration | Gay News

It won't be hard to pick out the Lesbian & Gay Band Association amid all the other contingents on Monday during the 57th Presidential Inauguration Parade. The honor guard will be carrying a rainbow Pride flag as it leads the rest of the band members across Pennsylvania Avenue.

item.title: The Beat of a Different Drummer
Different Drummers performs holiday concert | Out & About
item.description:
Different Drummers performs holiday concert | Out & About

Different Drummers performs its Winter Holiday Prism Concert at Lutheran Church of the Reformation (212 E Capitol St., N.E.) Sunday from 3-5 p.m. The concert will feature a combination of chamber ensembles, jazz and symphonic bands playing seasonal music. Donations for Different Drummers will be accepted as well as canned goods and basic toiletries for Food and Friends.

item.title: Different Drummers don drag
item.description:
Different Drummers don drag

D.C. Different Drummers Does Drag VI is at Town (2009 8th St., N.W.) on Sunday, Oct. 25 at 7 p.m. Kristina Kelly will host the night. Gladys Kravitz will make a special guest appearance. Proceeds benefit Different Drummers. Guests must be 21 and older for admittance. Cover is $10.

item.title: Capitol Pride 2011 Parade - DC's Different Drummers (DCDD)
item.description:
Capitol Pride 2011 Parade - DC's Different Drummers (DCDD)

DC's Different Drummers' contingent in the Capitol Pride Parade 2011 along 17th Street.

item.title: DC's Different Drummers @ Baltimore Pride
item.description:
DC's Different Drummers @ Baltimore Pride

Just some clips of DCDD warming up and then marching in Baltimore's pride parade. Sorry if it's a little shaky, I can't hold a damn camera steady to save my life!

item.title: Band in Motion - Metro Weekly
item.description:
Band in Motion - Metro Weekly

Bandmates: Clockwise from top: Conductor Scott Barker, Matt Swearman, Eddie Banks, Anja Maguire, Jodi Hains, Kim Webb, and Marc Martin-ez. (Photo by Michael Wichita ) The colorful sight of a marching band parading down the street during Capital Pride might be the first image that comes to mind when you think of the gay and lesbian musical organization D.C.'s Different Drummers.
